a.g: And when the stars fall, scattering,
And when the seas are erupted
And when the [contents of] graves are scattered,
A soul will [then] know what it has put forth and kept back.
O mankind, what has deceived you concerning your Lord, the Generous,

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
The day when the servants (of Allah) are driven forth, and with them are the witnesses, and the young turn gray-haired and the old become intoxicated. Then on that day, the scales are set up, the records are spread open, Hellfire is made manifest, the boiling water is heated, the Fire blazes forth, the disbelievers despair, the fires are kindled, the colors change, the tongue falls silent, and the limbs of the human being speak. 'O human being! What has deluded you concerning your Generous Lord (Rabbika al-Karim)?' For the doors have been closed, the curtains have been lowered, and you have concealed yourself from the creatures, yet you committed immorality. So what will you do when your limbs bear witness against you? Then woe upon woe to us, the heedless ones.

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Harms of the Tongue
Ata ibn Abi Rabah said: Those who came before you used to hate superfluous speech, and they considered superfluous speech to be anything except the Book of Allah the Exalted and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), or commanding good or forbidding evil, or speaking of your need in your livelihood which is indispensable for you. Do you deny that upon you are noble guardians (Hafizin) writing from the right and from the left seated? Not a word is uttered except that with him is a ready observer. Does not one of you feel ashamed when his record is spread out which he dictated at the beginning of his day, and most of what is in it is not from the matter of his religion nor his worldly life?

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
If the path of good has been made easy for you, then rejoice, for you are kept far from the Fire. And if you do not intend good except that obstacles surround you and repel it, and you do not intend evil except that its causes are made easy for you, then know that you are decreed against. For the indication of this upon the outcome is like the indication of rain upon vegetation and the indication of smoke upon fire. Indeed, Allah the Exalted has said: 'Indeed, the Righteous (Al-Abrar) are in Bliss (Na'eem), and indeed, the Wicked (Al-Fujjar) are in Blazing Fire (Jahim).' So present yourself upon the two verses, and you have known your abode from the two abodes. And Allah knows best.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Love, Longing, and Intimacy
These are the signs of love (Mahabbah), so whoever has these signs completed in him, then his love has been completed and his love has been purified, so his drink (Sharab) in the Hereafter becomes pure and his drinking place sweet. And whoever mixes with his love love for other than Allah, he enjoys in the Hereafter according to his love, since his drink is mixed with a measure of the drink of the Close Ones (Muqarrabun) as Allah the Exalted said regarding the Righteous (Al-Abrar): 'Indeed the Righteous (Al-Abrar) are in Bliss (Na'im)' then He said: 'They are given to drink of a sealed pure wine (Rahiq), its seal is musk - and for this let the competitors compete - and its mixture is of Tasnim, a spring from which drink those brought near (Muqarrabun).' So if the drink of the Righteous (Al-Abrar) becomes pleasant due to the mixing of the pure drink which is for the Close Ones (Muqarrabun). And the drink (Sharab) is an expression for the totality of the bliss (Na'im) of Paradise (Jinan), just as the Book (Kitab) expressed by it all the deeds, so He said: 'Indeed the record of the Righteous (Al-Abrar) is in Illiyyun' then He said: 'Witnessed by those brought near (Muqarrabun)' so it was a sign of the cause of their record that it rose to where it is witnessed by the Close Ones (Muqarrabun). And just as the Righteous (Al-Abrar) find increase in their state and their knowledge by their closeness to the Close Ones (Muqarrabun) and their witnessing of them, so will be their state in the Hereafter: 'He did not create you nor resurrect you except as a single soul (Nafs), as We began the first creation, We will repeat it' and as Allah the Exalted said: 'A recompense in proportion' meaning the recompense corresponded to their deeds, so the pure was met with the pure from the drink and the mixed was met with the mixed, and the mixing of every drink is according to what preceded of mixing in his love and his deeds: 'So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it, and whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it - and indeed Allah does not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves - Indeed Allah does not do injustice to the weight of an atom, and if it is a good deed He multiplies it - and if it is the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth, and sufficient are We as accountants.' So whoever his love in the world is his hope for the bliss (Na'im) of Paradise (Jannah) and the Houris (Hur al-'Ayn).

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Wonders of the Heart
He created Paradise and created for it people, so He employed them with obedience, and He created Hell and created for it people, so He employed them with disobedience. And He made known to the creation the sign of the people of Paradise and the people of Hell, so He said: 'Indeed, the righteous (Al-Abrar) are in bliss (Na'im), and indeed, the wicked (Al-Fujjar) are in a Blazing Fire (Jahim).' Then He, the Exalted, said in what is narrated from His Prophet (peace be upon him): 'These are in Paradise, and I do not care, and these are in Hell, and I do not care.'

a.g: And indeed, the wicked will be in Hellfire.
They will [enter to] burn therein on the Day of Recompense,
And never therefrom will they be absent.
And what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
Then, what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
It is the Day when a soul will not possess for another soul [power to do] a thing; and the command, that Day, is [entirely] with Allah.
